summary:
Urges parties to implement recommendations on the Gali sector and allow the opening of the Gali branch of the human rights office.

 Reiterates concern over the delayed deployment of the police component in the Gali sector.

 Welcomes measures to end activities of illegal armed groups and condemns ceasefire violations.

 Urges parties to abide by security protocols and cooperate to improve security.

 Reiterates calls for comprehensive security guarantees and freedom of movement for UNOMIG and CIS peacekeeping force personnel.

 Condemns repeated abductions and demands action to identify and bring perpetrators to justice.

 Extends the mandate of UNOMIG until 31 July 2005.

 Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed and report on the situation.

 Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
